intro: Agrostophyllum merrillii, commonly known as the Philippine sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Agrostophyllum merrillii plays a role in maintaining soil stability and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small fauna.
